name: postured

past simple and past participle of
posture
[ I ] to behave in a way that is intended to attract attention and interest, or to try to make people believe something that is not true: Businesses were co-operating across regional divides while the politicians postured. In the end, it simply looked like you were posturing. Posturing male politicians were favourites for the artists' cartoons.
